intro: Loeselia campechiana, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as woodlands and prairies. It has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Loeselia campechiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive flowers and compact growth habit.
